archimate:Capability.name: Data Operations and Support
archimate:Capability.documentation:
During its operational lifetime, data may be extracted, transformed, imported, edited, updated, cleansed, converted, integrated, segregated, aggregated, backed up, recovered, archived, retrieved, and deleted. Data is owned by the business, and support-ed by IT. The Data Operations and Support capability is the function of providing that technical support for centrally managed data, from data acquisition through to data purging.
The objectives of the data operations management capability are: • To protect and ensure the integrity of data assets. • To maintain the availability of data throughout its lifecycle. • To optimise the performance of data.
Database support is primarily database administration: • Implement and control database environments • Obtain externally sourced data • Plan for data recovery • Backup and recover data • Set database performance service levels • Monitor and tune database performance • Plan for data retention • Archive, retain, and purge data • Support specialised databases
Data technology management is primarily systems management: • Understand data technology requirements • Define the data technology architecture • Evaluate data technology • Install and administer data technology • Register and track data technology licenses • Support data technology usage and issue resolution
Data operations management includes two sub-capabilities: • Database support. • Data technology management.
Well managed data operations and support procedures protect and ensure the integrity of data assets, maintain the availability of data throughout its lifecycle, and optimise data performance.
